title: How to Clean a Coffee Maker After Each Use

steps.title: Disassemble the coffee maker.
steps.content: Disassemble the coffee maker. Remove any parts that come off, such as the pot, the brew basket, and any other removable parts. These part should be cleaned separately from the rest of the coffee maker. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Wash the removable parts.
steps.content: Wash the removable parts. Submerge the removable parts in warm, soapy water, and wash them using a dish rag. You can wash removable parts of your coffee maker the same way you would wash dishes. [2] X Research source Glass pots can be very breakable. When washing your coffee maker's pot, treat the glass gingerly. Some coffee makers may have parts that can be washed in a dishwasher. Check the instructions manual, if you still have it. If you're unsure if your coffee maker can be washed in the dishwasher, err on the side of caution and hand wash it.

steps.title: Wipe down the outside of the machine.
steps.content: Wipe down the outside of the machine. Take a wet, soapy rag and give the outside of the machine a good wipe down. Wipe down the sides and remove any coffee grinds from the warming plate. When you're down, wipe off any soap suds with a clean, damp rag. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Reassemble your machine.
steps.content: Reassemble your machine. After all the parts are dry, you can put your coffee machine back together. It is ready to use again. Make a habit of cleaning your coffee maker like this after each use.

steps.title: Add a vinegar and water solution to your coffee maker.
steps.content: Add a vinegar and water solution to your coffee maker. [4] X Expert Source Jonathan Tavarez Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 13 September 2019. Make a mixture using 2 parts warm water and 1 part white vinegar. [5] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019. The precise amounts will vary depending on the size of your coffee maker, but make roughly enough to fill the reservoir. Pour the mixture into the reservoir like you normally would with water when making coffee. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Let the coffee machine run half a brew cycle.
steps.content: Let the coffee machine run half a brew cycle. [7] X Expert Source Jonathan Tavarez Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 13 September 2019. Turn the coffee machine on. Keep an eye on it as it brews. Once about half the pot is full with the filtered vinegar/water mixture, turn the pot off. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Let the coffee maker sit for an hour.
steps.content: Let the coffee maker sit for an hour. Set a timer for an hour. Let the coffee pot sit for this time frame. [9] X Research source This will give the vinegar time to sit in the machine and clean out any mold.

steps.title: Complete the brew cycle.
steps.content: Complete the brew cycle. After letting the coffee maker sit for an hour, turn the machine back on. Let it run the rest of the brew cycle. [10] X Expert Source Jonathan Tavarez Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 13 September 2019. When done, all the vinegar/water mixture should be filtered into the pot. You can pour this mixture down the sink. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Run three brew cycles with plain water.
steps.content: Run three brew cycles with plain water. Fill your coffee pot with clean water. Pour this into the reservoir and run a complete brew cycle. [12] X Expert Source Jonathan Tavarez Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 13 September 2019. When it's done, pour the water out and run two more brew cycles with clean water. This should clean any vinegar out of your coffee maker. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Wipe down the coffee maker.
steps.content: Wipe down the coffee maker. After disinfecting the coffee maker, take a clean, damp rag. Wipe down the exterior of the machine to remove any dirt and debris. You should also make sure to remove coffee grinds from the warming plate. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Read your instruction's manual.
steps.content: Read your instruction's manual. If you still have the instructions manual, read it before cleaning your coffee maker. Most coffee makers can safely be cleaned with a vinegar/water mixture, but it's always a good idea to check first. [15] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source If you don't have the instructions manual, try looking up your model online. You may be able to find an instructions manual on the Internet.

steps.title: Leave the reservoir lid open.
steps.content: Leave the reservoir lid open. Many people keep the reservoir lid closed. However, it's a good idea to leave it open when not in use. This will help dry out the machine, preventing mold and bacteria from growing in a moist environment.

steps.title: Rinse the brew basket in the sink regularly.
steps.content: Rinse the brew basket in the sink regularly. The brew basket is very susceptible to mold as it gets wet during the brewing process. Make sure you rinse out the brew basket after each use and make a habit of cleaning it each time you do dishes. This will keep your coffee maker mold and germ free.
